title: 112_s1353
content: The Act titled "Transportation Security Administration Efficiency and Flexibility Act of 2011" excludes employees of the Transportation Security Administration from collective bargaining rights of federal employees. The Act "Transportation Security Administration Efficiency and Flexibility Act of 2011" excludes Transportation Security Administration officers and employees from collective bargaining rights under title 5, United States Code. The Transportation Security Administration of the Department of Homeland Security is subject to specific sections of title 5, United States Code. Amendments to title 49 include changes to the personnel management system for the Transportation Security Administration. The amendments made by this section to title 5, United States Code, will take effect upon the enactment of the Act and apply to any collective bargaining agreement entered into on or after that date. Employee rights and engagement mechanism for passenger and property screeners are addressed in Section 3. Employee rights and engagement mechanism for passenger and property screeners are addressed in Section 3. The Aviation and Transportation Security Act is amended to clarify labor organization membership and appeal rights for individuals carrying out screening functions. The Administrator can appeal adverse actions to the Merit Systems Protection Board under certain conditions. Employee engagement mechanisms must be provided at airports where the Transportation Security Administration screens passengers and property. Section 111(d)(1) of the Homeland Security Act is amended to replace references to the "Under Secretary of Transportation for Security" with "Administrator of the Transportation Security Administration." Additionally, Section 883 of the same Act is amended to include whistleblower protections for the Aviation and Transportation Security Act.
